onboarding.welcome.title: Welcome to Thaumic Cast
onboarding.welcome.subtitle: The server side of the equation
onboarding.welcome.body_windows: This application acts as the bridge between your browser and your Sonos speakers. It lurks quietly in your system tray, ready to channel audio when called upon.
onboarding.welcome.body_macos: This application acts as the bridge between your browser and your Sonos speakers. It lurks quietly in your menu bar, ready to channel audio when called upon.
onboarding.welcome.body_linux: This application acts as the bridge between your browser and your Sonos speakers. It lurks quietly in your system tray, ready to channel audio when called upon.
onboarding.welcome.footnote: Think of it as a very dedicated postal service for sound.
onboarding.firewall.title: A Brief Interruption
onboarding.firewall.warning_text_windows: In a moment, Windows will likely ask for permission to allow network access. This is normal and entirely necessary.
onboarding.firewall.warning_text_macos: macOS, and any diligent gatekeepers like Little Snitch, may ask about connections to unfamiliar addresses. Some will begin with 224.*. That's multicast, which is a polite way of asking the local network if anyone's in and wants a cup of tea.
onboarding.firewall.warning_text_linux: Depending on your firewall configuration, you may need to allow incoming connections on ports 49400-49410.
onboarding.firewall.reason_1: Your browser extension needs to send audio data to this app
onboarding.firewall.reason_2: This app needs to communicate with your Sonos speakers
onboarding.firewall.reason_3: All traffic stays on your local network — nothing leaves your home
onboarding.firewall.reassurance_windows: Click 'Allow' when Windows asks. If you use a third-party firewall, you may also see connections to 224.* addresses. That's local multicast used for discovery and not the sort of thing that wanders off the premises. We won't be rascals with your trust.
onboarding.firewall.reassurance_macos: Click 'Allow' when asked. Those 224.* addresses aren't the wider, darker internet. They're local multicast, which by design can't leave your network. Your secrets remain comfortably at home.
onboarding.firewall.reassurance_linux: If you're using a firewall like ufw or firewalld, you may need to open ports 49400-49410 for TCP.

onboarding.speakers.subtitle: Let's find your Sonos devices
onboarding.speakers.none_found_hint: Speakers can be shy. Check that they're powered on and connected to the same network as this computer.
onboarding.speakers.searching: Searching for speakers on your network...
onboarding.speakers.manual_hint: For networks where discovery has opinions
onboarding.speakers.manual_error_not_son: That doesn't seem to be a Sonos speaker
onboarding.speakers.manual_error_invalid: That doesn't look like an IP address
onboarding.extension.title: The Browser Extension
onboarding.extension.subtitle: The other half of the equation
onboarding.extension.body: You'll need the Thaumic Cast browser extension to capture audio from your tabs. It's the bit that does the actual capturing.
onboarding.extension.skip_hint: You can always install it later from the Chrome Web Store.
onboarding.ready.title: The Ritual is Complete
onboarding.ready.subtitle: Your speakers await instruction
onboarding.ready.intro: You can now stream audio from up to {{maxStreams}} browser tabs simultaneously. The universe has limits, and apparently this is one of them.
onboarding.ready.performance_body: This works best for music. Latency is typically 100–300ms, which is imperceptible when listening to songs but quite noticeable if you're trying to conduct an orchestra.
onboarding.ready.battery_warning: Laptops running on battery power may experience occasional hiccups, as your computer decides that saving energy is more important than your listening pleasure. Browsers can be particularly zealous about this.
onboarding.ready.autostart_description: Have Thaumic Cast ready and waiting when you arrive, like a particularly attentive butler for your audio needs.
